variable_options.label: SPI
variable_options.description:
Standardised Precipitation Index
Measure of "drought" using the Standardised Precipitation Index on time scales of 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48 and 60 months. A drought measure specified as a precipitation deficit. See McKee et al. (1993) and the SPI User Guide (World Meteorological Organization 2012) for details.

variable_options.label: SPEI
variable_options.description:
Standardised Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index
Measure of "drought" using the Standardised Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index on time scales of 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48 and 60 months. A drought measure specified using precipitation and evaporation.

variable_options.label: CDD
variable_options.description: Maximum length of dry spell: maximum number of consecutive days with daily rainfall rate < 1mm

variable_options.label: CDDCOLD18
variable_options.description: Cooling degree days Annual sum of difference between daily mean temperature with 18. A measure of the energy demand needed to cool a building.

variable_options.label: CSDI
variable_options.description:
Cold spell duration index: annual count of days with at least 6 consecutive days when TN < 10th percentile
Let TNij be the daily maximum temperature on day i in period j and let TNin10 be the calendar day 10th percentile centred on a 5-day window for the base period 1961-1990. Then the number of days per period is summed where, in intervals of at least 6 consecutive days, TNij < TNin10.

variable_options.label: CSDI3
variable_options.description:
Cold spell duration index: annual count of days with at least 3 consecutive days when TN < 10th percentile
CSDI Annual number of days contributing to events where 3 or more consecutive days experience TN < 10th percentile.

variable_options.label: CWD
variable_options.description: Maximum length of wet spell: maximum number of consecutive days of daily precipitation amount with day rainfall rate ≥ 1mm

variable_options.label: DTR
variable_options.description: Daily temperature range between maximum temperature and minimum temperature.

variable_options.label: GDDGROW10
variable_options.description: Growing degree days Annual sum of difference between daily mean temperature difference with 10. A measure of heat accumulation used to predict plant growth rates.

variable_options.label: GSL
variable_options.description: Growing season length Annual* count between the first span of at least 6 days with daily mean temperature >5 °C and the first span after July 1st (Jan 1st in SH) of 6 days with daily mean temperature <5 °C. (* Annual means Jan 1st to Dec 31st in the Northern Hemisphere (NH); July 1st to June 30th in the Southern Hemisphere (SH).)

variable_options.label: HDDHEAT18
variable_options.description: Heating degree days Annual sum of difference between 18 with daily mean temperature . A measure of the energy demand needed to heat a building.
